contentrichtext.text: '''Vologases II of Parthia''' ({{lang-fa|ولاش دوم}}, ruled 51–78) ruled the [[Parthia|Parthian Empire]] from about 77 to 80. Little is known about him. Vologases II was the son of [[Vologases I of Parthia]] and was of mixed [[Parthians|Parthian]] and [[Greeks|Greek]] ancestry<ref name=" Tarn, William Woodthorpe 2010 51-52 ">{{cite book|author= Tarn, William Woodthorpe |title=The Greeks in Bactria and India |publisher=Cambridge University Press |year=2010 |page=51-52 |isbn=1108009417, 9781108009416 |quote= ...for earlier Arsacids married their half- sisters or other princesses, and the first king whose mother was a Greek concubine Vologases I, A.D. 57-77; the statement cannot be earlier than his reign.}}</ref><ref name=" Bunson, Matthew 1995 454 ">{{cite book |author= Bunson, Matthew |title=A Dictionary of the Roman Empire |publisher=Oxford University Press |year=1995 |page=454 |isbn=0195102339, 9780195102338 |quote= VOLOGASES I (d. 80 A.D.) King of Parthia from circa 51 to 80 A.D.; the greatest of the five kings who would bear his name, although Parthia was troubled throughout his reign on both its eastern and western borders. He was the son of VONONES II, a one-time monarch of Media-Atropatene. His mother was reportedly a Greek concubine.}}</ref> It seems that Vologases II was defeated and deposed by his uncle, [[Pacorus II of Parthia]] (ruled c. 78–105). His son was [[Vologases III of Parthia]]. == Footnotes == {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-hou|[[Arsacid Empire|Arsacid dynasty]]||||}} {{s-bef|before=[[Vologases I of Parthia|Vologases I]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of kings of Persia|Great King (Shah) of Parthia]]|years=77–80}} {{s-aft|after=[[Pacorus II of Parthia|Pacorus II]]}} {{end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vologases 02 Of Parthia}} {{Parthian kings}} [[Category:80 deaths]] [[Category:Parthian kings]] [[Category:1st-century monarchs in the Middle East]]
